issue.title: added octohub: low level python and cli interface to github
issue.body:
OctoHub is a Python package that provides a low level interface to the full GitHub v3 API.

It was developed out of a need to have a one-to-one interface to the GitHub API based on the excellent online documentation, with the least amount of abstraction. Although, it does do its part by parsing raw JSON responses into Pythonic attribute dictionaries, as well providing an optional iterative Pager for handling pagination.

Also included is a command line interface for quick interaction with GitHub's API, as well as higher level contrib scripts (currently offline-issues and gist, but more coming...).

commits.message: added octohub: low level python and cli interface to github

Merge pull request #272 from alonswartz/add-octohub-python-lib

added octohub: low level python and cli interface to github

forkee.name: hubot-scripts
forkee.description: optional scripts for hubot, opt in via hubot-scripts.json

issue.title: Add first draft GitHub feature slides
issue.body: Starting with a WIP to get team review on possible chapters discussing GitHub features and summaries. This is not to copy/duplicate anything in the Help, but to surface features that might be help to integration into custom slide decks or high-level examinations of Git and GitHub integration.

issue.title: What use are roles?
issue.body:
Hi, i've setup my auth env variable and assigned a few roles. The docs say

```
Hubot has first class support for specify roles which a user must have to run specific commands. If you wish you use this support you must set the the following environment variables:
```

However there is no detail on how to protect commands with these roles.

comment.body: There documentation in the script explaining how to protect commands: https://github.com/github/hubot/blob/master/src/scripts/auth.coffee#L17..L27

issue.title: Github flavoured markdown doesn't support Javascript links. (for bookmarklets)
issue.body:
I have a readme that I want to have a link for a bookmarklet to in. The link starts with javascript:.....

Due to this, github doesn't render the link, and instead renders it as a link to github.com

comment.body:
+1
Just show some visual warning next to it, some icon or something similar.

issue.title: Doubled information in manual
issue.body:
http://git-scm.com/book/ru section 5.5 and 5.6 in Russian translation are not translated and are double info of sections 5.3 and.5.4 on English.

It is better just to remove 5.5 and 5.6 from Russian version of manual.
